There are many organizations and platforms that connect volunteers with literacy programs and education-related causes. Here are some suggestions:

1. **Reading Partners**: A national nonprofit that provides one-on-one reading tutoring to elementary school students. You can volunteer as a reading partner and help students improve their reading skills.
2. **Literacy Volunteers of America (LVA)**: A national organization that provides literacy services to adults and children. You can volunteer as a tutor, teacher, or in other capacities.
3. **BookPALS (Performing Artists for Literacy in Schools)**: A program that brings actors, writers, and other performers into schools to read aloud to students and promote literacy.
4. **Reading to Kids**: A nonprofit that provides free reading programs to underserved schools. You can volunteer to read to students and help them develop a love for reading.
5. **Everybody Wins!**: A national nonprofit that provides reading and mentoring programs to low-income students. You can volunteer as a reading mentor and help students improve their reading skills.
6. **iCouldBe**: A nonprofit that provides online mentoring and literacy programs to high school students. You can volunteer as a mentor and help students develop their writing and reading skills.
7. **DonorsChoose.org**: A platform that allows you to fund and volunteer for education projects in public schools. You can search for literacy-related projects and volunteer your time or donate to support them.
8. **VolunteerMatch**: A platform that connects volunteers with nonprofit organizations. You can search for literacy-related volunteer opportunities in your area.
9. **Idealist**: A platform that connects volunteers with nonprofit organizations. You can search for literacy-related volunteer opportunities in your area.
10. **United Way**: A nonprofit that provides education and literacy programs to communities. You can volunteer with your local United Way chapter and participate in literacy-related programs.
11. **National Education Association (NEA) Foundation**: A nonprofit that provides grants and resources to educators. You can volunteer with the NEA Foundation and participate in literacy-related programs.
12. **Pajama Program**: A nonprofit that provides new pajamas and books to children in need. You can volunteer to read to children and help them develop a love for reading.

These are just a few examples of organizations and platforms that connect volunteers with literacy programs and education-related causes. You can also search for local organizations in your area that focus on literacy and education.

Remember to consider your skills, interests, and availability when selecting a volunteer opportunity. Good luck!
